page.title: 20Population and Language
page.content: The villages of Dyserth and Meliden have increased gradually in size,in Dyserth from 1363 in 1931,to about 2697 in 1983 and Meliden from 918 in 1931,to 2697 in 1971.At the same time there has been a decline in the percentage of people able to speak Welsh,in Meliden from 23% in 1961,to 13.9% in 1981 and at Dyserth from 40% in 1961,to 24.7% in 1981. Dyserth has two Welsh Methodist Chapels,Bethel for the Presbyterians and Mynydd Seion for the Wesleyans.The United Reformed Church is the English Presbyterian Church and the Parish Church is part of the Church in Wales. Meliden also has two Welsh Chapels, Salem for the Wesleyans ans Seion for the Presbyterians.St.Melyd is its Parish Church.
